output.conclusion: By completing this course, you've established a solid foundation in drawing fundamentals. Continue practicing and exploring different techniques to further develop your artistic skills!
output.introduction: Welcome to Drawing Fundamentals! This course will guide you through the essential concepts and techniques to start your drawing journey. No prior experience is necessary.

chapters.description: Overview of pencils (HB, 2B, etc.), erasers, paper types, and other essential drawing tools. Understanding their uses and differences.
Learn the proper grip for sketching and shading. Explore different grips for varying line weights and control.
Practice drawing straight lines, curved lines, and circles. Focus on control and consistency.

modules.moduleTitle: Getting Started: Tools and Basic Lines

chapters.description: Learn to identify and draw basic shapes like circles, squares, triangles, and rectangles.
Practice combining basic shapes to create more complex forms. Examples: houses, trees, simple objects.
Introduction to negative space and how it can help improve your drawing accuracy.
Understanding one-point perspective and its basic principles.
Practice drawing cubes and cylinders in one-point perspective.
Understanding the horizon line and vanishing point and their role in creating depth.
Introduction to light sources, highlights, shadows, and reflected light.
Learn basic shading techniques like hatching, cross-hatching, and blending.
Practice applying shading techniques to basic shapes to create the illusion of depth and volume.
Practice drawing a simple still life arrangement using the techniques learned in previous modules.
A quick recap of the fundamental concepts covered in the course.
Suggestions for further learning and resources to continue your drawing journey.
